title: Jill & Keen
content:
How do you get to see the text with Keen in it in Jill of the Jungle?
I've not been able to find it in any of the three episodes, or did I miss something?------------------------------

title: Re: Jill & Keen
content:
It's somewhere on the map of the first episode:
[url=http://www.3drealms.com/keenhistory/jilljungle.html]picture[/url]Groeten van Frenkel

title: Re: Jill & Keen
content:
Hm... I always thought that was in the story of the game, for some reason. I can't find it, either. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Hmm...
content: That's very strange... I just had a quick look then and it didn't turn up. I skipped over most of the first level, so perhaps it's some kind of bonus for completing the previous level to a certain degree?

title: Re: Jill & Keen
content:
It pops up in the first episode, when you collect the apple on the world map after completing level one.

I put a more detailed explanation and a screenshot on the [url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/Cameo_Appearances#Jill_of_the_Jungle]cameo page[/url].[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: & Kill Jeen
content: That's exactly what I did earlier, but it didn't show up. Are you certain there's no other criteria?

title: Re: & Kill Jeen
content:
Hmm, well I skipped through the level pretty quickly too, so I don't think there's any criteria. In fact, I don't think I've ever *not* seen that message, like most in-game popups it has always irritated me by slowing me down (just like the Bio Menace popups which appear the first time you collect an item, which has really been annoying me over the last few days [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] )

FWIW in the first level I collected the knife, some apples that were in my path anyway, killed the crocodile and two frogs, and ran into one of the flame birds...[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Hmm...
content:
Are you using the shareware version or full version? I'm on the latter. I just tried it again twice, the second time around completing the level in full, and still no dice.

On another note, Jill on a loud sound system is very satisfying.

title: Re: Hmm...
content:
Yep, full version and loud sound system here too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/jn1save.0]Try putting this[/url] into your Jill folder and restoring the game in the first save slot. Collecting the next apple on the screen shows the popup for me. (You may need to already have a savegame in the first save slot for this to work.)[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Wha?
content: That worked fine. Intriguing.

title: Re: Wha?
content: Maybe there's something up with your world map file?  If you compare it to [url=http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/map.jn1]my version[/url], is there any difference?  (Use "cmp" under Linux or I think "fc" under Windows.)<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Wha?
content: Yep, that'll be it. I imagine SM and Genius must have this same version. The documentation says it's 1.2.

title: Re: Wha?
content: Hmm, well I can't find anything in my copy to tell me what version it is...<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Wha?
content:
Going by the documentation's version number, I have version 1.0, and it does contain the reference to Keen. But I'm not sure if that version number even relates to the actual game...

Apart from the documentation's number, there doesn't seem to be any other version numbers listed anywhere. It's the same with Jazz Jackrabbit, Xargon, and probably other Epic games of the time. Kinda makes it hard to collect all the different versions of the game if you can't tell which is which.


Edit: Actually, there's a version number in Xargon. It's on the title screen's level map, just above the top of the area shown on the title screen.

Obviously, this means it's not ordinarily viewable, unless you switch the title screen's level map (which I've forgotten the name of) with a level map that appears in the game as a playable level.

And the point of me typing out all of this unrelated Xargon nonsense is that maybe there is a version number somewhere on the title screen map for Jill, which can give some indication as to whether the HELPME document's version number is the same as the game's version number. And then we can be sure which version of Jill contains the Keen message.

title: Re: Wha?
content:
Maps contain within them the text that any 'text apples' have in them, as well as any text printed 'in level'; so a different map level will have different text, it's even possible to edit said text, if only imperfectly.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Wha?
content:
Actually that's not the case for Jill - map.jn1 is the map level for the first episode, but the "apple text" is stored in jill1.vcl.

And unfortunately swapping map.jn1 and intro.jn1 doesn't reveal any hidden text. Mine does say "This is shareware" for episode one though.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Wha?
content:
So it should display in shareware...

content:

And yes, the shareware version I got when the game first came out was where I first saw that text.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Jill!
content: On a seperate Jill-related issue, how come the game pauses for several seconds every time the music loops?  I never had the issue when I was using my old computer years ago, but in DOSBox, I've found the game frustrating to play because of the entire game locking up for 3-4 full seconds every time the music file has to restart.

title: Re: Jill!
content: What version of DOSBox are you using?  I've never had a problem like that.  It's not an issue with disk access is it?  (Like your hard drive spinning down, and when the music loops the game tries to access the music file on disk, which causes a delay until your hard drive spins up again.)<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Jill!
content:
I've tried all three versions of Jill of the Jungle from [url=http://www.classicdosgames.com/epic.html]Classic DOS Games[/url] and only in version 1.0 I get the Keen reference when I eat the apple.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Jill!
content:
It was probably removed at the request of Apogee. That's my guess at least.--------------------

title: Re: Jill!
content:
I have a shareware version, not sure which one it is, but in a JILL1.VCL file (IIRC), there are references to our dear Billy, Duke Nukem (damn Megagames!) and Mario.

They do not appear in-game however, when I eat apples in the map level.

Hum... Duke and Keen should do the same with Jill at some point.------------------------------

title: grr
content:
Malv: I'm using 0.70, which I just updated to from 0.65 yesterday.

I tried running Jill again, to see if the new update resolved anything--it let me have sound effects, but the pause at music-loop seems to get worse and worse as the game runs longer. The first time the level music looped it took about a second and a half to unfreeze. That was hardly anything to complain about... but the second time, it was 6 seconds, and the third was at least 10... the fourth time I gave it about 30 seconds and then killed DOSBox.

I've got no clue--maybe it's the version of Jill I'm using? I didn't get the apple news block on the map screen, either, but I distinctly remember it from my childhood.

title: Re: grr
content:
I've seen the Keen text in the game when I get that apple. It was in the shareware version, I don't remember what version number though."A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Re: grr
content: That's really strange Xky, have you tried downloading a "fresh" copy of the shareware version, and seeing if that makes any difference?  Maybe renaming your DOSBox config file and trying the default settings might shed some light on it too?<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: grr
content:
Shush! Maybe he has a special version![img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Great.
content: You're right, Malv.  Downloaded a new shareware version, and the music loops fine.  The shareware I downloaded uses "Jill.exe" to play, while the version I had uses "Jill1.exe."  :\

title: Re: Great.
content:
That's interesting, because the original shareware version of Jill I had went straight into the game (like yours with an .exe, I can't remember the name), but years later I found a different shareware version that had a jill.bat instead. That one worked the same way as Kiloblaster, in that the .bat file loads jjfile0.exe which gives you an episode list to choose from, and that in turn loads jjfile1.exe for episode one.

Out of curiosity, are the .ddt files the same between both versions? It's possible that since they're the music files, if they became corrupted it could cause music problems.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

The DDT files are the same size between versions... but the FILE_ID.DIZ is different. The version that runs fine claims to be 1.2, while the version that gave me trouble has no version number on it.

Crazy that there's so many different distributions!
